titleStmt.title: John F. Fisk to James F. Robinson
CWG7672

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Military Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Frankfort Ky
Aug 23d 1862
His Excellency Gov
James F. Robinson
Sir,

Captain James L. Foley of Covington desires a position in the army, He has had experience -- was in the famous Springfield Missouri charge -- He is a fine figure -- zealous Union man -- heartily and ardent, By his request I present his name for a field office, I recommend him to your favorable consideration

Military
Speaker Fisks
Recom of Mr Foley
